# Original code on the API documentation
```{r, eval=F}
#Original code from API documentation
library(httr)

headers <- list(
  "X-API-Key" = "api_key",
  "X-API-Secret" = "secret"
)

API_BASE_URL <- "https://swissdox.linguistik.uzh.ch/api"
API_URL_QUERY <- paste0(API_BASE_URL, "/query")

yaml_example <- ("
    query:
        sources:
            - SRF
        dates:
            - from: 2023-10-07
              to: 2024-05-16
        languages:
            - de
        content:
            - Hammas
            - Gaza
            - PalÃ¤stina
            - Israel
    result:
        format: TSV
        maxResults: 10000000
        columns:
            - id
            - pubtime
            - medium_code
            - medium_name
            - rubric
            - regional
            - doctype
            - doctype_description
            - language
            - char_count
            - dateline
            - head
            - subhead
            - content_id
            - content
    version: 1.2
")

data <- list(
  "query" = yaml_example,
  "test" = "1",
  "name" = "Query name 1",
  "comment" = "Query comment",
  "expirationDate" = "2023-02-28"
)

response <- POST(
  API_URL_QUERY,
  add_headers(.headers = headers),
  body = data,
  encode = "json"
)

print(content(response, "text"))


```


# Edited code to fit R-Programminglanguage
```{r}
#set the API key and secret
api_key <- rstudioapi::askForPassword()
api_secret <- rstudioapi::askForPassword()

headers <- list(
  "X-API-Key" = "api_key",
  "X-API-Secret" = "secret"
)
```

```{r}
#load query from query.yml in the data directory
query_yml <- readLines("../data_prep/query.yml")

```

```{r}
library(httr)

#submit the query
response <- POST(url = "https://swissdox.linguistik.uzh.ch/api/query",
                 add_headers("X-API-Key" = api_key, "X-API-Secret" = api_secret),
                 body = list(query = query_yml, test = "1", name = "Query name 1"),
                 encode = "json")

print(content(response, "parsed"))
```

# Alternative way by downloading the data direclty from the website and loading it into R
```{r}
#create df with the data in the data repository

data_srf <- read_tsv("../data/data_srf.tsv")

head (data_srf)
```
